title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that wheat production increased in both regions.

Two points for comparing how the trend lines in East Asia and Africa increased by referencing data from the graph.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that pesticides and irrigation pumps improved wheat production in East Asia.

Two points for explaining how pesticides and irrigation pumps helped to improve wheat yields in East Asia.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that Africa was not as wealthy as South Asia during the Green Revolution.

Two points for explaining why the Green Revolution was successful in South Asia and/or not successful in Africa.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following reasons why the Green Revolution had different impacts on farming in African countries compared to South Asian countries:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the Green Revolution had different impacts on farming in African countries compared to South Asian countries:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that increased wheat yields led to increased rural-urban migration in all regions on the graph.

Two points for explaining how and why wheat farming yields increased as rural-to-urban migration increased at the same time in the regions shown on the graph.
